   216â†’## GPU Acceleration Implementation Plan ğŸš€ (2025-07-16)
   217â†’
   218â†’### CUDA Integration Roadmap
   219â†’
   220â†’#### Phase 1: Core CUDA Infrastructure (Weeks 1-2)
   221â†’- **CUDA Tensor Support**: Extend `vsla_tensor_t` with GPU memory management
   222â†’- **Memory Management**: Implement unified memory and explicit GPU/CPU transfers
   223â†’- **Build System**: Add CUDA compiler integration to CMake
   224â†’- **Error Handling**: Extend error codes for CUDA-specific failures
   225â†’
   226â†’#### Phase 2: GPU Kernels (Weeks 3-4)
   227â†’- **Element-wise Operations**: CUDA kernels for add, subtract, scale
   228â†’- **FFT Convolution**: cuFFT integration for high-performance convolution
   229â†’- **Matrix Operations**: cuBLAS integration for dense linear algebra
   230â†’- **Memory Optimization**: Coalesced memory access patterns
   231â†’
   232â†’#### Phase 3: Variable-Shape GPU Algorithms (Weeks 5-6)
   233â†’- **Adaptive Padding**: GPU-efficient automatic shape handling
   234â†’- **Kernel Fusion**: Combine multiple operations in single GPU launches
   235â†’- **Stream Processing**: Asynchronous execution for pipeline optimization
   236â†’- **Memory Pooling**: Reduce allocation overhead for variable shapes
   237â†’
   238â†’#### Phase 4: Advanced GPU Features (Weeks 7-8)
   239â†’- **Multi-GPU Support**: Distribute large tensors across multiple GPUs
   240â†’- **Tensor Cores**: Leverage mixed-precision for supported operations
   241â†’- **Graph Optimization**: Fuse operation sequences for maximum throughput
   242â†’- **Benchmarking**: Comprehensive GPU performance validation
   243â†’
   244â†’### Technical Implementation Details
   245â†’
   246â†’#### CUDA Tensor Structure
   247â†’```c
   248â†’typedef struct {
   249â†’    // Existing CPU fields
   250â†’    uint8_t    rank;
   251â†’    uint8_t    model;
   252â†’    uint8_t    dtype;
   253â†’    uint8_t    flags;
   254â†’    uint64_t  *shape;
   255â†’    uint64_t  *cap;
   256â†’    uint64_t  *stride;
   257â†’    void      *data;
   258â†’    
   259â†’    // New GPU fields
   260â†’    void      *gpu_data;        // GPU memory pointer
   261â†’    cudaStream_t stream;        // CUDA stream for async operations
   262â†’    uint8_t   location;         // 0=CPU, 1=GPU, 2=UNIFIED
   263â†’    uint8_t   gpu_id;          // GPU device ID
   264â†’} vsla_tensor_t;
   265â†’```
   266â†’
   267â†’#### GPU Memory Management
   268â†’- **Unified Memory**: Automatic migration between CPU/GPU
   269â†’- **Explicit Control**: Manual GPU memory management for performance
   270â†’- **Memory Pools**: Pre-allocated GPU memory for variable shapes
   271â†’- **Synchronization**: Efficient CPU-GPU data transfers
   272â†’
   273â†’#### CUDA Kernel Design
   274â†’- **Coalesced Access**: Optimize memory bandwidth utilization
   275â†’- **Occupancy Optimization**: Maximize GPU core utilization
   276â†’- **Dynamic Parallelism**: Handle variable-shape operations efficiently
   277â†’- **Error Handling**: Robust GPU error detection and recovery
   278â†’
   279â†’### Performance Targets
   280â†’
   281â†’#### GPU vs CPU Speedup Goals
   282â†’- **Element-wise Operations**: 10-50Ã— speedup for large tensors
   283â†’- **FFT Convolution**: 20-100Ã— speedup using cuFFT
   284â†’- **Matrix Operations**: 50-200Ã— speedup using cuBLAS
   285â†’- **Variable-Shape**: 5-20Ã— speedup with efficient padding
   286â†’
   287â†’#### Memory Efficiency Goals
   288â†’- **Bandwidth Utilization**: >80% of theoretical GPU memory bandwidth
   289â†’- **Occupancy**: >75% GPU core utilization for compute kernels
   290â†’- **Memory Overhead**: <20% additional memory for shape management
   291â†’- **Transfer Efficiency**: Minimize CPU-GPU data movement
   292â†’
   293â†’### Competitive Benchmarking Plan
   294â†’
   295â†’#### Top 3 Competitors for GPU Comparison
   296â†’1. **CuPy**: GPU-accelerated NumPy equivalent
   297â†’2. **cuBLAS**: NVIDIA's optimized BLAS for GPU
   298â†’3. **cuFFT**: NVIDIA's optimized FFT library
   299â†’
   300â†’#### Fair Comparison Strategy
   301â†’- **Same Hardware**: All benchmarks on same GPU (RTX 5090)
   302â†’- **Same Precision**: Float32 and Float64 comparisons
   303â†’- **Same Algorithms**: FFT convolution, matrix operations, element-wise
   304â†’- **Realistic Workloads**: Variable-shape scenarios from real applications
   305â†’
   306â†’### Risk Assessment
   307â†’
   308â†’#### Technical Risks
   309â†’- **CUDA Complexity**: Steep learning curve for GPU programming
   310â†’- **Memory Management**: Complex unified memory performance tuning
   311â†’- **Debugging**: Limited GPU debugging tools compared to CPU
   312â†’- **Platform Dependence**: CUDA locks us to NVIDIA hardware
   313â†’
   314â†’#### Mitigation Strategies
   315â†’- **Incremental Development**: Start with simple kernels, add complexity gradually
   316â†’- **Comprehensive Testing**: Extensive GPU validation and correctness tests
   317â†’- **Performance Profiling**: Use NVIDIA Nsight for optimization
   318â†’- **Fallback Support**: Maintain CPU-only execution path
   319â†’
   320â†’### Success Metrics
   321â†’
   322â†’#### Development Milestones
   323â†’- **Week 2**: Basic GPU tensor creation and memory management
   324â†’- **Week 4**: Element-wise operations achieving 10Ã— speedup
   325â†’- **Week 6**: FFT convolution achieving 20Ã— speedup
   326â†’- **Week 8**: Complete GPU benchmark suite vs top 3 competitors
   327â†’
   328â†’#### Quality Gates
   329â†’- **Correctness**: All existing tests pass on GPU
   330â†’- **Performance**: GPU operations must be faster than CPU for sizes >1024
   331â†’- **Memory Safety**: Zero GPU memory leaks in valgrind/cuda-memcheck
   332â†’- **Reproducibility**: Consistent results across multiple GPU runs
   333â†’

   377â†’## Current GPU Benchmarking Status ğŸ” (2025-07-16 Update)
   378â†’

   380â†’During comprehensive benchmark validation, we discovered that:
   381â†’- âœ… **GPU Vector Addition**: Working and competitive (1.19-1.36Ã— vs cuBLAS)

   392â†’### Next Priority: Implement Pure VSLA GPU Convolution ğŸ¯
   393â†’
   394â†’**Task**: Implement `vsla_gpu_conv_fft()` function in `src/vsla_gpu.cu` with **pure VSLA implementation**
   395â†’
   396â†’**Critical Design Decision**: **NO cuFFT Dependency**
   397â†’- Must implement FFT convolution entirely from scratch using pure CUDA
   398â†’- Cannot use cuFFT, cuBLAS, or any NVIDIA library primitives
   399â†’- This ensures VSLA's variable-shape algorithms are properly showcased
   400â†’- Maintains competitive fairness (we're benchmarking against cuFFT, not using it)
   401â†’
   402â†’**Requirements**:
   403â†’1. **Custom FFT Implementation**: Pure CUDA FFT kernels (Cooley-Tukey algorithm)
   404â†’2. **Variable-Shape Optimization**: Efficient padding and shape handling for VSLA tensors
   405â†’3. **Complex Arithmetic Kernels**: Custom point-wise multiplication in frequency domain
   406â†’4. **Memory Management**: Efficient GPU memory allocation for complex-valued arrays
   407â†’5. **Error Handling**: Proper VSLA error codes and edge case management
   408â†’
   409â†’**Expected Performance Target**: 
   410â†’- Current cuFFT baseline: 8-9Î¼s for size 256
   411â†’- Target VSLA GPU: 10-15Î¼s (realistic for custom implementation vs highly optimized cuFFT)
   412â†’- Current "fake" result: 0.25Î¼s (just error handling time)
   413â†’
   414â†’**Implementation Strategy**:
   415â†’1. **Study VSLA CPU convolution**: Understand current `vsla_conv()` algorithm implementation
   416â†’2. **Design GPU FFT kernels**: Implement Cooley-Tukey FFT with CUDA optimizations
   417â†’3. **Variable-shape handling**: Efficient GPU padding strategies for arbitrary tensor shapes
   418â†’4. **Complex arithmetic**: Custom kernels for frequency-domain point-wise operations
   419â†’5. **Integration**: Connect with existing GPU tensor infrastructure
   420â†’6. **Validation**: Verify correctness against CPU convolution results
   421â†’7. **Optimization**: Tune for GPU memory coalescing and occupancy
   422â†’
   423â†’**Technical Challenges**:
   424â†’- FFT implementation complexity (much harder than using cuFFT)
   425â†’- GPU memory bandwidth optimization for variable shapes
   426â†’- Maintaining numerical accuracy without cuFFT's optimizations
   427â†’- Achieving competitive performance with custom kernels
   428â†’
   429â†’**Success Criteria**:
   430â†’- Correctness: Results match CPU convolution exactly
   431â†’- Performance: Within 2Ã— of cuFFT (realistic for custom implementation)  
   432â†’- Memory efficiency: Minimal GPU memory overhead
   433â†’- Integration: Seamless with existing VSLA GPU tensor system
   434â†’
   435â†’This implementation would complete the GPU acceleration story and provide a fair comparison for the final publication benchmarks.

## GPU Acceleration Implementation Plan ğŸš€ (2025-07-16)

### CUDA Integration Roadmap

#### Phase 1: Core CUDA Infrastructure (Weeks 1-2)
- **CUDA Tensor Support**: Extend `vsla_tensor_t` with GPU memory management
- **Memory Management**: Implement unified memory and explicit GPU/CPU transfers
- **Build System**: Add CUDA compiler integration to CMake
- **Error Handling**: Extend error codes for CUDA-specific failures

#### Phase 2: GPU Kernels (Weeks 3-4)
- **Element-wise Operations**: CUDA kernels for add, subtract, scale
- **FFT Convolution**: cuFFT integration for high-performance convolution
- **Matrix Operations**: cuBLAS integration for dense linear algebra
- **Memory Optimization**: Coalesced memory access patterns

#### Phase 3: Variable-Shape GPU Algorithms (Weeks 5-6)
- **Adaptive Padding**: GPU-efficient automatic shape handling
- **Kernel Fusion**: Combine multiple operations in single GPU launches
- **Stream Processing**: Asynchronous execution for pipeline optimization
- **Memory Pooling**: Reduce allocation overhead for variable shapes

#### Phase 4: Advanced GPU Features (Weeks 7-8)
- **Multi-GPU Support**: Distribute large tensors across multiple GPUs
- **Tensor Cores**: Leverage mixed-precision for supported operations
- **Graph Optimization**: Fuse operation sequences for maximum throughput
- **Benchmarking**: Comprehensive GPU performance validation

### Technical Implementation Details

#### CUDA Tensor Structure
```c
typedef struct {
    // Existing CPU fields
    uint8_t    rank;
    uint8_t    model;
    uint8_t    dtype;
    uint8_t    flags;
    uint64_t  *shape;
    uint64_t  *cap;
    uint64_t  *stride;
    void      *data;
    
    // New GPU fields
    void      *gpu_data;        // GPU memory pointer
    cudaStream_t stream;        // CUDA stream for async operations
    uint8_t   location;         // 0=CPU, 1=GPU, 2=UNIFIED
    uint8_t   gpu_id;          // GPU device ID
} vsla_tensor_t;
```

#### GPU Memory Management
- **Unified Memory**: Automatic migration between CPU/GPU
- **Explicit Control**: Manual GPU memory management for performance
- **Memory Pools**: Pre-allocated GPU memory for variable shapes
- **Synchronization**: Efficient CPU-GPU data transfers

#### CUDA Kernel Design
- **Coalesced Access**: Optimize memory bandwidth utilization
- **Occupancy Optimization**: Maximize GPU core utilization
- **Dynamic Parallelism**: Handle variable-shape operations efficiently
- **Error Handling**: Robust GPU error detection and recovery

### Performance Targets

#### GPU vs CPU Speedup Goals
- **Element-wise Operations**: 10-50Ã— speedup for large tensors
- **FFT Convolution**: 20-100Ã— speedup using cuFFT
- **Matrix Operations**: 50-200Ã— speedup using cuBLAS
- **Variable-Shape**: 5-20Ã— speedup with efficient padding

#### Memory Efficiency Goals
- **Bandwidth Utilization**: >80% of theoretical GPU memory bandwidth
- **Occupancy**: >75% GPU core utilization for compute kernels
- **Memory Overhead**: <20% additional memory for shape management
- **Transfer Efficiency**: Minimize CPU-GPU data movement

### Competitive Benchmarking Plan

#### Top 3 Competitors for GPU Comparison
1. **CuPy**: GPU-accelerated NumPy equivalent
2. **cuBLAS**: NVIDIA's optimized BLAS for GPU
3. **cuFFT**: NVIDIA's optimized FFT library

#### Fair Comparison Strategy
- **Same Hardware**: All benchmarks on same GPU (RTX 5090)
- **Same Precision**: Float32 and Float64 comparisons
- **Same Algorithms**: FFT convolution, matrix operations, element-wise
- **Realistic Workloads**: Variable-shape scenarios from real applications

### Risk Assessment

#### Technical Risks
- **CUDA Complexity**: Steep learning curve for GPU programming
- **Memory Management**: Complex unified memory performance tuning
- **Debugging**: Limited GPU debugging tools compared to CPU
- **Platform Dependence**: CUDA locks us to NVIDIA hardware

#### Mitigation Strategies
- **Incremental Development**: Start with simple kernels, add complexity gradually
- **Comprehensive Testing**: Extensive GPU validation and correctness tests
- **Performance Profiling**: Use NVIDIA Nsight for optimization
- **Fallback Support**: Maintain CPU-only execution path

### Success Metrics

#### Development Milestones
- **Week 2**: Basic GPU tensor creation and memory management
- **Week 4**: Element-wise operations achieving 10Ã— speedup
- **Week 6**: FFT convolution achieving 20Ã— speedup
- **Week 8**: Complete GPU benchmark suite vs top 3 competitors

#### Quality Gates
- **Correctness**: All existing tests pass on GPU
- **Performance**: GPU operations must be faster than CPU for sizes >1024
- **Memory Safety**: Zero GPU memory leaks in valgrind/cuda-memcheck
- **Reproducibility**: Consistent results across multiple GPU runs

## GPU Implementation Status ğŸš€ (2025-07-16)

### Completed GPU Tasks âœ…
1. âœ… **GPU Implementation Started** - Created vsla_gpu.cu with pure CUDA kernels
2. âœ… **Removed Competitor Dependencies** - Eliminated cuBLAS/cuFFT usage per competitive requirements
3. âœ… **Pure CUDA Kernels** - Implemented custom kernels for all operations:
   - Element-wise addition (float32/float64)

   - Matrix multiplication (tiled algorithm)
   - Memory management (allocation, copy, synchronization)
4. âœ… **C23 Compatibility Layer** - Created vsla_gpu_types.h to handle CUDA's lack of C23 support

   - Device detection and information

   - CPU-GPU consistency verification

### Current GPU Architecture
- **Pure CUDA Implementation**: No dependency on cuBLAS, cuFFT, or other NVIDIA libraries
- **Custom Kernels**: Hand-optimized CUDA kernels for variable-shape operations
- **Compatibility Layer**: Abstracts C23 types for CUDA compatibility
- **Extensible Design**: Test framework accommodates future optimizations

### GPU Performance Expectations
- **Element-wise Operations**: Expected 10-50Ã— speedup vs CPU
- **Matrix Multiplication**: Custom tiled algorithm targeting 20-100Ã— speedup
- **Memory Efficiency**: Coalesced access patterns for optimal bandwidth

### Next Steps for GPU
1. **Enable GPU Compilation**: Need to ensure vsla_gpu.cu is compiled (currently using stub)
2. **Run GPU Tests**: Validate all GPU functionality works correctly
3. **Performance Benchmarking**: Compare against CPU implementation
4. **Optimization**: Further kernel optimization based on profiling

### Technical Decisions Made
- **No cuBLAS/cuFFT**: Ensures fair competition by not using the libraries we're competing against
- **C99/CUDA Compatibility**: Avoided C23 features that CUDA doesn't support
- **gcc-12 Requirement**: CUDA 12.0 requires gcc â‰¤ 12 for compilation

## Current GPU Benchmarking Status ğŸ” (2025-07-16 Update)

### Discovery: GPU Convolution Not Implemented
During comprehensive benchmark validation, we discovered that:
- âœ… **GPU Vector Addition**: Working and competitive (1.19-1.36Ã— vs cuBLAS)
- âœ… **GPU Matrix Multiplication**: Working and excellent (3.54-5.76Ã— vs cuBLAS, 794 GFLOPS peak)
- âŒ **GPU Convolution**: Returns `VSLA_ERROR_NOT_IMPLEMENTED` - is just a TODO placeholder

### Benchmark System Status
- âœ… **Complete Infrastructure**: Single-command benchmark with all 3 competitors

### Next Priority: Implement Pure VSLA GPU Convolution ğŸ¯

**Task**: Implement `vsla_gpu_conv_fft()` function in `src/vsla_gpu.cu` with **pure VSLA implementation**

**Critical Design Decision**: **NO cuFFT Dependency**
- Must implement FFT convolution entirely from scratch using pure CUDA
- Cannot use cuFFT, cuBLAS, or any NVIDIA library primitives
- This ensures VSLA's variable-shape algorithms are properly showcased
- Maintains competitive fairness (we're benchmarking against cuFFT, not using it)

**Requirements**:
1. **Custom FFT Implementation**: Pure CUDA FFT kernels (Cooley-Tukey algorithm)
2. **Variable-Shape Optimization**: Efficient padding and shape handling for VSLA tensors
3. **Complex Arithmetic Kernels**: Custom point-wise multiplication in frequency domain
4. **Memory Management**: Efficient GPU memory allocation for complex-valued arrays
5. **Error Handling**: Proper VSLA error codes and edge case management

**Expected Performance Target**: 
- Current cuFFT baseline: 8-9Î¼s for size 256
- Target VSLA GPU: 10-15Î¼s (realistic for custom implementation vs highly optimized cuFFT)
- Current "fake" result: 0.25Î¼s (just error handling time)

**Implementation Strategy**:
1. **Study VSLA CPU convolution**: Understand current `vsla_conv()` algorithm implementation
2. **Design GPU FFT kernels**: Implement Cooley-Tukey FFT with CUDA optimizations
3. **Variable-shape handling**: Efficient GPU padding strategies for arbitrary tensor shapes
4. **Complex arithmetic**: Custom kernels for frequency-domain point-wise operations
5. **Integration**: Connect with existing GPU tensor infrastructure
6. **Validation**: Verify correctness against CPU convolution results
7. **Optimization**: Tune for GPU memory coalescing and occupancy

**Technical Challenges**:
- FFT implementation complexity (much harder than using cuFFT)
- GPU memory bandwidth optimization for variable shapes
- Maintaining numerical accuracy without cuFFT's optimizations
- Achieving competitive performance with custom kernels

**Success Criteria**:
- Correctness: Results match CPU convolution exactly
- Performance: Within 2Ã— of cuFFT (realistic for custom implementation)  
- Memory efficiency: Minimal GPU memory overhead
- Integration: Seamless with existing VSLA GPU tensor system

This implementation would complete the GPU acceleration story and provide a fair comparison for the final publication benchmarks.

/**
 * @file vsla_ops.h
 * @brief Basic operations on VSLA tensors
 * 
 * @copyright MIT License
 */

#ifndef VSLA_OPS_H
#define VSLA_OPS_H

#include "vsla_tensor.h"

#ifdef __cplusplus
extern "C" {
#endif

/**
 * @brief Expand the rank of a tensor by adding new dimensions
 * 
 * This is a zero-copy operation that increases the rank of a tensor by
 * appending new dimensions. The original data is preserved, and the new
 * dimensions are implicitly zero-padded.
 * 
 * @param tensor Input tensor
 * @param new_rank New rank (must be >= current rank)
 * @param target_cap Array of target capacities for new dimensions (can be NULL)
 * @return VSLA_SUCCESS or error code
 */
vsla_error_t vsla_pad_rank(vsla_tensor_t* tensor, uint8_t new_rank, 
                           const uint64_t target_cap[]);

/**
 * @brief Add two tensors element-wise
 * 
 * Performs element-wise addition after automatic padding to compatible shapes.
 * The output tensor must be pre-allocated with sufficient capacity.
 * 
 * @param out Output tensor (pre-allocated)
 * @param a First input tensor
 * @param b Second input tensor
 * @return VSLA_SUCCESS or error code
 */
vsla_error_t vsla_add(vsla_tensor_t* out, const vsla_tensor_t* a, 
                      const vsla_tensor_t* b);

/**
 * @brief Subtract two tensors element-wise
 * 
 * @param out Output tensor (pre-allocated)
 * @param a First input tensor

     5â†’ * This module provides a single, simple API that automatically uses the best
     6â†’ * available hardware (CPU/GPU) and vendor libraries (cuFFT, rocFFT, MKL) to
     7â†’ * achieve maximum performance without requiring users to manage hardware details.
     8â†’ * 
     9â†’ * @copyright MIT License
    10â†’ */

    12â†’#ifndef VSLA_UNIFIED_H

    17â†’#include <stdbool.h>

    22â†’#endif
    23â†’
    24â†’/**
    25â†’ * @brief Hardware backend type
    26â†’ */
    27â†’typedef enum {
    28â†’    VSLA_BACKEND_CPU = 0,           /**< CPU-only execution */
    29â†’    VSLA_BACKEND_CUDA = 1,          /**< NVIDIA GPU via CUDA */
    30â†’    VSLA_BACKEND_ROCM = 2,          /**< AMD GPU via ROCm */
    31â†’    VSLA_BACKEND_ONEAPI = 3,        /**< Intel GPU via oneAPI */
    32â†’    VSLA_BACKEND_AUTO = 4           /**< Auto-select best available */
    33â†’} vsla_backend_t;
    34â†’
    35â†’/**
    36â†’ * @brief Unified tensor structure that abstracts CPU/GPU memory

Perfect! I can see the conflict clearly:
- **Basic API**: `vsla_add(out, a, b)` - 3 parameters
- **Unified API**: `vsla_add(ctx, out, a, b)` - 4 parameters

The simplest solution is to rename the basic API functions with a `_basic` suffix to avoid conflicts. Let me implement this fix:

/**
 * @file vsla_ops.h
 * @brief Basic operations on VSLA tensors
 * 
 * @copyright MIT License
 */

#ifndef VSLA_OPS_H
#define VSLA_OPS_H

#include "vsla_tensor.h"

#ifdef __cplusplus
extern "C" {
#endif

/**
 * @brief Expand the rank of a tensor by adding new dimensions
 * 
 * This is a zero-copy operation that increases the rank of a tensor by
 * appending new dimensions. The original data is preserved, and the new
 * dimensions are implicitly zero-padded.
 * 
 * @param tensor Input tensor
 * @param new_rank New rank (must be >= current rank)
 * @param target_cap Array of target capacities for new dimensions (can be NULL)
 * @return VSLA_SUCCESS or error code
 */
vsla_error_t vsla_pad_rank(vsla_tensor_t* tensor, uint8_t new_rank, 
                           const uint64_t target_cap[]);

/**
 * @brief Add two tensors element-wise
 * 
 * Performs element-wise addition after automatic padding to compatible shapes.
 * The output tensor must be pre-allocated with sufficient capacity.
 * 
 * @param out Output tensor (pre-allocated)
 * @param a First input tensor
 * @param b Second input tensor
 * @return VSLA_SUCCESS or error code
 */
vsla_error_t vsla_add(vsla_tensor_t* out, const vsla_tensor_t* a, 
                      const vsla_tensor_t* b);

/**
 * @brief Subtract two tensors element-wise
 * 
 * @param out Output tensor (pre-allocated)
 * @param a First input tensor
 * @param b Second input tensor
 * @return VSLA_SUCCESS or error code
 */
vsla_error_t vsla_sub(vsla_tensor_t* out, const vsla_tensor_t* a, 
                      const vsla_tensor_t* b);

/**
 * @brief Scale a tensor by a scalar
 * 
 * @param out Output tensor (can be same as input for in-place operation)
 * @param tensor Input tensor
 * @param scalar Scalar multiplier
 * @return VSLA_SUCCESS or error code
 */
vsla_error_t vsla_scale(vsla_tensor_t* out, const vsla_tensor_t* tensor, 
                        double scalar);

/**
 * @brief Element-wise multiplication (Hadamard product)
 * 
 * @param out Output tensor (pre-allocated)
 * @param a First input tensor
 * @param b Second input tensor
 * @return VSLA_SUCCESS or error code
 */
vsla_error_t vsla_hadamard(vsla_tensor_t* out, const vsla_tensor_t* a, 
                           const vsla_tensor_t* b);

/**
 * @brief Matrix multiplication for 2D tensors
 * 
 * @param out Output tensor (pre-allocated)
 * @param a First matrix
 * @param b Second matrix
 * @return VSLA_SUCCESS or error code
 */
vsla_error_t vsla_matmul(vsla_tensor_t* out, const vsla_tensor_t* a, 
                         const vsla_tensor_t* b);

/**
 * @brief Transpose a 2D tensor (matrix)
 * 
 * @param out Output tensor (pre-allocated)
 * @param tensor Input tensor (must be rank 2)
 * @return VSLA_SUCCESS or error code
 */
vsla_error_t vsla_transpose(vsla_tensor_t* out, const vsla_tensor_t* tensor);

/**
 * @brief Reshape a tensor (must preserve total number of elements)

/**
 * @file vsla_tensor.h
 * @brief Core tensor data structure and basic operations
 * 
 * @copyright MIT License
 */

#ifndef VSLA_TENSOR_H
#define VSLA_TENSOR_H

#include "vsla_core.h"

#ifdef __cplusplus
extern "C" {
#endif

/**
 * @brief Core tensor structure for VSLA
 * 
 * This structure represents a multi-dimensional tensor with variable shape.
 * The tensor supports automatic zero-padding to make operations between
 * tensors of different shapes well-defined.
 */
typedef struct {
    uint8_t    rank;      /**< Number of axes (dimensions), 0-255 */
    uint8_t    model;     /**< Model: 0 = convolution, 1 = Kronecker */
    uint8_t    dtype;     /**< Data type: 0 = f64, 1 = f32 */
    uint8_t    flags;     /**< Reserved for future use */

    uint64_t  *shape;     /**< Logical extent per axis (length = rank) */
    uint64_t  *cap;       /**< Padded/allocated extent per axis */
    uint64_t  *stride;    /**< Byte strides for row-major traversal */
    void      *data;      /**< Contiguous buffer, size = Î  cap[i] * sizeof(dtype) */
} vsla_tensor_t;

/**
 * @brief Create a new tensor
 * 
 * Allocates a new tensor with the specified rank, shape, model, and data type.
 * The capacity (cap) for each dimension is set to the next power of 2 >= shape[i].
 * 
 * @param rank Number of dimensions (0-255)
 * @param shape Array of dimension sizes (length = rank)
 * @param model Model type (VSLA_MODEL_A or VSLA_MODEL_B)
 * @param dtype Data type (VSLA_DTYPE_F64 or VSLA_DTYPE_F32)
 * @return Pointer to new tensor, or NULL on error
 */
vsla_tensor_t* vsla_new(uint8_t rank, const uint64_t shape[], 
                        vsla_model_t model, vsla_dtype_t dtype);

/**
 * @brief Free a tensor and all its allocated memory
 * 
 * @param tensor Tensor to free (can be NULL)
 */
void vsla_free(vsla_tensor_t* tensor);

/**
 * @brief Create a copy of a tensor
 * 
 * @param tensor Tensor to copy
 * @return New tensor with copied data, or NULL on error
 */
vsla_tensor_t* vsla_copy(const vsla_tensor_t* tensor);

/**
 * @brief Create a tensor filled with zeros
 * 
 * @param rank Number of dimensions
 * @param shape Array of dimension sizes
 * @param model Model type
 * @param dtype Data type
 * @return New zero tensor, or NULL on error
 */
vsla_tensor_t* vsla_zeros(uint8_t rank, const uint64_t shape[],
                          vsla_model_t model, vsla_dtype_t dtype);

/**
 * @brief Create a tensor filled with ones
 * 
 * @param rank Number of dimensions
 * @param shape Array of dimension sizes
 * @param model Model type
 * @param dtype Data type
 * @return New tensor filled with ones, or NULL on error
 */
vsla_tensor_t* vsla_ones(uint8_t rank, const uint64_t shape[],
                         vsla_model_t model, vsla_dtype_t dtype);

/**
 * @brief Get the total number of elements in the tensor (based on shape)
 * 
 * @param tensor Input tensor
 * @return Number of elements, or 0 if tensor is NULL
 */
uint64_t vsla_numel(const vsla_tensor_t* tensor);

/**
 * @brief Get the total allocated capacity (based on cap)
 * 
 * @param tensor Input tensor
 * @return Total capacity, or 0 if tensor is NULL
 */
uint64_t vsla_capacity(const vsla_tensor_t* tensor);

/**
 * @brief Get a pointer to an element in the tensor
 * 
 * @param tensor Input tensor
 * @param indices Array of indices (length = rank)
 * @return Pointer to element, or NULL if out of bounds
 */
void* vsla_get_ptr(const vsla_tensor_t* tensor, const uint64_t indices[]);

/**
 * @brief Get a double value from the tensor (with type conversion if needed)
 * 
 * @param tensor Input tensor
 * @param indices Array of indices
 * @param value Output value
 * @return VSLA_SUCCESS or error code
 */
vsla_error_t vsla_get_f64(const vsla_tensor_t* tensor, const uint64_t indices[], 
                          double* value);

/**
 * @brief Set a double value in the tensor (with type conversion if needed)
 * 
 * @param tensor Input tensor
 * @param indices Array of indices
 * @param value Value to set
 * @return VSLA_SUCCESS or error code
 */
vsla_error_t vsla_set_f64(vsla_tensor_t* tensor, const uint64_t indices[], 
                          double value);

/**
 * @brief Fill tensor with a constant value
 * 
 * @param tensor Tensor to fill
 * @param value Value to fill with
 * @return VSLA_SUCCESS or error code
 */
vsla_error_t vsla_fill(vsla_tensor_t* tensor, double value);

/**
 * @brief Print tensor information to stdout
 * 
 * @param tensor Tensor to print
 * @param name Optional name for the tensor

/**
 * @file vsla_tensor.h
 * @brief Core tensor data structure and basic operations
 * 
 * @copyright MIT License
 */

#ifndef VSLA_TENSOR_H
#define VSLA_TENSOR_H

#include "vsla_core.h"

#ifdef __cplusplus
extern "C" {
#endif

/**
 * @brief Core tensor structure for VSLA
 * 
 * This structure represents a multi-dimensional tensor with variable shape.
 * The tensor supports automatic zero-padding to make operations between
 * tensors of different shapes well-defined.
 */
typedef struct {
    uint8_t    rank;      /**< Number of axes (dimensions), 0-255 */
    uint8_t    model;     /**< Model: 0 = convolution, 1 = Kronecker */
    uint8_t    dtype;     /**< Data type: 0 = f64, 1 = f32 */
    uint8_t    flags;     /**< Reserved for future use */

    uint64_t  *shape;     /**< Logical extent per axis (length = rank) */
    uint64_t  *cap;       /**< Padded/allocated extent per axis */
    uint64_t  *stride;    /**< Byte strides for row-major traversal */
    void      *data;      /**< Contiguous buffer, size = Î  cap[i] * sizeof(dtype) */
} vsla_tensor_t;

/**
 * @brief Create a new tensor
 * 
 * Allocates a new tensor with the specified rank, shape, model, and data type.
 * The capacity (cap) for each dimension is set to the next power of 2 >= shape[i].
 * 
 * @param rank Number of dimensions (0-255)
 * @param shape Array of dimension sizes (length = rank)
 * @param model Model type (VSLA_MODEL_A or VSLA_MODEL_B)
 * @param dtype Data type (VSLA_DTYPE_F64 or VSLA_DTYPE_F32)
 * @return Pointer to new tensor, or NULL on error
 */
vsla_tensor_t* vsla_new(uint8_t rank, const uint64_t shape[], 
                        vsla_model_t model, vsla_dtype_t dtype);

/**
 * @brief Free a tensor and all its allocated memory
 * 
 * @param tensor Tensor to free (can be NULL)
 */
void vsla_free(vsla_tensor_t* tensor);

/**
 * @brief Create a copy of a tensor
 * 
 * @param tensor Tensor to copy
 * @return New tensor with copied data, or NULL on error
 */
vsla_tensor_t* vsla_copy(const vsla_tensor_t* tensor);

/**
 * @brief Create a tensor filled with zeros
 * 
 * @param rank Number of dimensions
 * @param shape Array of dimension sizes
 * @param model Model type
 * @param dtype Data type
 * @return New zero tensor, or NULL on error
 */
vsla_tensor_t* vsla_zeros(uint8_t rank, const uint64_t shape[],
                          vsla_model_t model, vsla_dtype_t dtype);

/**
 * @brief Create a tensor filled with ones
 * 
 * @param rank Number of dimensions
 * @param shape Array of dimension sizes
 * @param model Model type
 * @param dtype Data type
 * @return New tensor filled with ones, or NULL on error
 */
vsla_tensor_t* vsla_ones(uint8_t rank, const uint64_t shape[],
                         vsla_model_t model, vsla_dtype_t dtype);

/**
 * @brief Get the total number of elements in the tensor (based on shape)
 * 
 * @param tensor Input tensor
 * @return Number of elements, or 0 if tensor is NULL
 */
uint64_t vsla_numel(const vsla_tensor_t* tensor);

/**
 * @brief Get the total allocated capacity (based on cap)
 * 
 * @param tensor Input tensor
 * @return Total capacity, or 0 if tensor is NULL
 */
uint64_t vsla_capacity(const vsla_tensor_t* tensor);

/**
 * @brief Get a pointer to an element in the tensor
 * 
 * @param tensor Input tensor
 * @param indices Array of indices (length = rank)
 * @return Pointer to element, or NULL if out of bounds
 */
void* vsla_get_ptr(const vsla_tensor_t* tensor, const uint64_t indices[]);

/**
 * @brief Get a double value from the tensor (with type conversion if needed)
 * 
 * @param tensor Input tensor
 * @param indices Array of indices
 * @param value Output value
 * @return VSLA_SUCCESS or error code
 */
vsla_error_t vsla_get_f64(const vsla_tensor_t* tensor, const uint64_t indices[], 
                          double* value);

/**
 * @brief Set a double value in the tensor (with type conversion if needed)
 * 
 * @param tensor Input tensor
 * @param indices Array of indices
 * @param value Value to set
 * @return VSLA_SUCCESS or error code
 */
vsla_error_t vsla_set_f64(vsla_tensor_t* tensor, const uint64_t indices[], 
                          double value);

/**
 * @brief Fill tensor with a constant value
 * 
 * @param tensor Tensor to fill
 * @param value Value to fill with
 * @return VSLA_SUCCESS or error code
 */
vsla_error_t vsla_fill(vsla_tensor_t* tensor, double value);

/**
 * @brief Print tensor information to stdout
 * 
 * @param tensor Tensor to print
 * @param name Optional name for the tensor
 */
void vsla_print(const vsla_tensor_t* tensor, const char* name);

/**
 * @brief Check if two tensors have the same shape
 * 
 * @param a First tensor
 * @param b Second tensor
 * @return 1 if shapes match, 0 otherwise
 */
int vsla_shape_equal(const vsla_tensor_t* a, const vsla_tensor_t* b);

/**
 * @brief Create the zero element for the semiring
 * 
 * @param model Model type
 * @param dtype Data type
 * @return Zero tensor (empty tensor), or NULL on error
 */
vsla_tensor_t* vsla_zero_element(vsla_model_t model, vsla_dtype_t dtype);

/**
 * @brief Create the one element for the semiring
 * 
 * @param model Model type
 * @param dtype Data type
 * @return One tensor (1D tensor with single element 1), or NULL on error
 */
vsla_tensor_t* vsla_one_element(vsla_model_t model, vsla_dtype_t dtype);

#ifdef __cplusplus
}
#endif

toolUseResult.originalFile:
/**
 * @file vsla_tensor.h
 * @brief Core tensor data structure and basic operations
 * 
 * @copyright MIT License
 */

#ifndef VSLA_TENSOR_H
#define VSLA_TENSOR_H

#include "vsla_core.h"

#ifdef __cplusplus
extern "C" {
#endif

/**
 * @brief Core tensor structure for VSLA
 * 
 * This structure represents a multi-dimensional tensor with variable shape.
 * The tensor supports automatic zero-padding to make operations between
 * tensors of different shapes well-defined.
 */
typedef struct {
    uint8_t    rank;      /**< Number of axes (dimensions), 0-255 */
    uint8_t    model;     /**< Model: 0 = convolution, 1 = Kronecker */
    uint8_t    dtype;     /**< Data type: 0 = f64, 1 = f32 */
    uint8_t    flags;     /**< Reserved for future use */

    uint64_t  *shape;     /**< Logical extent per axis (length = rank) */
    uint64_t  *cap;       /**< Padded/allocated extent per axis */
    uint64_t  *stride;    /**< Byte strides for row-major traversal */
    void      *data;      /**< Contiguous buffer, size = Î  cap[i] * sizeof(dtype) */
} vsla_tensor_t;

/**
 * @brief Create a new tensor
 * 
 * Allocates a new tensor with the specified rank, shape, model, and data type.
 * The capacity (cap) for each dimension is set to the next power of 2 >= shape[i].
 * 
 * @param rank Number of dimensions (0-255)
 * @param shape Array of dimension sizes (length = rank)
 * @param model Model type (VSLA_MODEL_A or VSLA_MODEL_B)
 * @param dtype Data type (VSLA_DTYPE_F64 or VSLA_DTYPE_F32)
 * @return Pointer to new tensor, or NULL on error
 */
vsla_tensor_t* vsla_new(uint8_t rank, const uint64_t shape[], 
                        vsla_model_t model, vsla_dtype_t dtype);

/**
 * @brief Free a tensor and all its allocated memory
 * 
 * @param tensor Tensor to free (can be NULL)
 */
void vsla_free(vsla_tensor_t* tensor);

/**
 * @brief Create a copy of a tensor
 * 
 * @param tensor Tensor to copy
 * @return New tensor with copied data, or NULL on error
 */
vsla_tensor_t* vsla_copy_basic(const vsla_tensor_t* tensor);

/**
 * @brief Create a tensor filled with zeros
 * 
 * @param rank Number of dimensions
 * @param shape Array of dimension sizes
 * @param model Model type
 * @param dtype Data type
 * @return New zero tensor, or NULL on error
 */
vsla_tensor_t* vsla_zeros(uint8_t rank, const uint64_t shape[],
                          vsla_model_t model, vsla_dtype_t dtype);

/**
 * @brief Create a tensor filled with ones
 * 
 * @param rank Number of dimensions
 * @param shape Array of dimension sizes
 * @param model Model type
 * @param dtype Data type
 * @return New tensor filled with ones, or NULL on error
 */
vsla_tensor_t* vsla_ones(uint8_t rank, const uint64_t shape[],
                         vsla_model_t model, vsla_dtype_t dtype);

/**
 * @brief Get the total number of elements in the tensor (based on shape)
 * 
 * @param tensor Input tensor
 * @return Number of elements, or 0 if tensor is NULL
 */
uint64_t vsla_numel(const vsla_tensor_t* tensor);

/**
 * @brief Get the total allocated capacity (based on cap)
 * 
 * @param tensor Input tensor
 * @return Total capacity, or 0 if tensor is NULL
 */
uint64_t vsla_capacity(const vsla_tensor_t* tensor);

/**
 * @brief Get a pointer to an element in the tensor
 * 
 * @param tensor Input tensor
 * @param indices Array of indices (length = rank)
 * @return Pointer to element, or NULL if out of bounds
 */
void* vsla_get_ptr(const vsla_tensor_t* tensor, const uint64_t indices[]);

/**
 * @brief Get a double value from the tensor (with type conversion if needed)
 * 
 * @param tensor Input tensor
 * @param indices Array of indices
 * @param value Output value
 * @return VSLA_SUCCESS or error code
 */
vsla_error_t vsla_get_f64(const vsla_tensor_t* tensor, const uint64_t indices[], 
                          double* value);

/**
 * @brief Set a double value in the tensor (with type conversion if needed)
 * 
 * @param tensor Input tensor
 * @param indices Array of indices
 * @param value Value to set
 * @return VSLA_SUCCESS or error code
 */
vsla_error_t vsla_set_f64(vsla_tensor_t* tensor, const uint64_t indices[], 
                          double value);

/**
 * @brief Fill tensor with a constant value
 * 
 * @param tensor Tensor to fill
 * @param value Value to fill with
 * @return VSLA_SUCCESS or error code
 */
vsla_error_t vsla_fill(vsla_tensor_t* tensor, double value);

/**
 * @brief Print tensor information to stdout
 * 
 * @param tensor Tensor to print
 * @param name Optional name for the tensor
 */
void vsla_print(const vsla_tensor_t* tensor, const char* name);

/**
 * @brief Check if two tensors have the same shape
 * 
 * @param a First tensor
 * @param b Second tensor
 * @return 1 if shapes match, 0 otherwise
 */
int vsla_shape_equal(const vsla_tensor_t* a, const vsla_tensor_t* b);

/**
 * @brief Create the zero element for the semiring
 * 
 * @param model Model type
 * @param dtype Data type
 * @return Zero tensor (empty tensor), or NULL on error
 */
vsla_tensor_t* vsla_zero_element(vsla_model_t model, vsla_dtype_t dtype);

/**
 * @brief Create the one element for the semiring
 * 
 * @param model Model type
 * @param dtype Data type
 * @return One tensor (1D tensor with single element 1), or NULL on error
 */
vsla_tensor_t* vsla_one_element(vsla_model_t model, vsla_dtype_t dtype);

#ifdef __cplusplus
}
#endif

#endif /* VSLA_TENSOR_H */

/**
 * @file vsla_conv.h
 * @brief Model A operations - Convolution semiring
 * 
 * @copyright MIT License
 */

#ifndef VSLA_CONV_H
#define VSLA_CONV_H

#include "vsla_tensor.h"

#ifdef __cplusplus
extern "C" {
#endif

/**
 * @brief Convolution of two tensors (Model A multiplication)
 * 
 * Computes the discrete convolution of two tensors. For vectors v and w:
 * (v * w)_k = sum_{i+j=k+1} v_i * w_j
 * 
 * The output dimension is d1 + d2 - 1 where d1 and d2 are the input dimensions.
 * Uses FFT for efficiency when available.
 * 
 * @param out Output tensor (pre-allocated with correct dimensions)
 * @param a First input tensor (must be Model A)
 * @param b Second input tensor (must be Model A)
 * @return VSLA_SUCCESS or error code
 */
vsla_error_t vsla_conv(vsla_tensor_t* out, const vsla_tensor_t* a, 
                       const vsla_tensor_t* b);

/**
 * @brief Direct convolution (no FFT)
 * 
 * Computes convolution using the direct O(n*m) algorithm.
 * Useful for small tensors or when FFT is not available.
 * 
 * @param out Output tensor

/**
 * @file vsla_conv.h
 * @brief Model A operations - Convolution semiring
 * 
 * @copyright MIT License
 */

#ifndef VSLA_CONV_H
#define VSLA_CONV_H

#include "vsla_tensor.h"

#ifdef __cplusplus
extern "C" {
#endif

/**
 * @brief Convolution of two tensors (Model A multiplication)
 * 
 * Computes the discrete convolution of two tensors. For vectors v and w:
 * (v * w)_k = sum_{i+j=k+1} v_i * w_j
 * 
 * The output dimension is d1 + d2 - 1 where d1 and d2 are the input dimensions.
 * Uses FFT for efficiency when available.
 * 
 * @param out Output tensor (pre-allocated with correct dimensions)
 * @param a First input tensor (must be Model A)
 * @param b Second input tensor (must be Model A)
 * @return VSLA_SUCCESS or error code
 */
vsla_error_t vsla_conv(vsla_tensor_t* out, const vsla_tensor_t* a, 
                       const vsla_tensor_t* b);

/**
 * @brief Direct convolution (no FFT)
 * 
 * Computes convolution using the direct O(n*m) algorithm.
 * Useful for small tensors or when FFT is not available.
 * 
 * @param out Output tensor
 * @param a First input tensor
 * @param b Second input tensor
 * @return VSLA_SUCCESS or error code
 */
vsla_error_t vsla_conv_direct(vsla_tensor_t* out, const vsla_tensor_t* a, 
                              const vsla_tensor_t* b);

/**
 * @brief FFT-based convolution
 * 
 * Uses Fast Fourier Transform for O(n log n) convolution.
 * Falls back to radix-2 implementation if FFTW is not available.
 * 
 * @param out Output tensor
 * @param a First input tensor
 * @param b Second input tensor
 * @return VSLA_SUCCESS or error code
 */
vsla_error_t vsla_conv_fft(vsla_tensor_t* out, const vsla_tensor_t* a, 
                           const vsla_tensor_t* b);

/**
 * @brief Matrix multiplication for Model A
 * 
 * Performs matrix multiplication where each element is a Model A tensor
 * and multiplication uses convolution.
 * 
 * @param out Output matrix of tensors
 * @param A First matrix (m x k)
 * @param B Second matrix (k x n)
 * @param m Number of rows in A
 * @param k Number of columns in A / rows in B
 * @param n Number of columns in B
 * @return VSLA_SUCCESS or error code
 */
vsla_error_t vsla_matmul_conv(vsla_tensor_t** out, vsla_tensor_t** A, 
                              vsla_tensor_t** B, size_t m, size_t k, size_t n);

/**
 * @brief Compute polynomial coefficients from Model A tensor
 * 
 * Extracts the polynomial representation where tensor elements
 * are coefficients of x^0, x^1, x^2, ...
 * 
 * @param tensor Input tensor (Model A)
 * @param coeffs Output coefficient array (pre-allocated)
 * @param max_degree Maximum degree to extract
 * @return VSLA_SUCCESS or error code
 */
vsla_error_t vsla_to_polynomial(const vsla_tensor_t* tensor, double* coeffs, 
                                size_t max_degree);

/**
 * @brief Create Model A tensor from polynomial coefficients
 * 
 * @param coeffs Coefficient array
 * @param degree Polynomial degree
 * @param dtype Data type for tensor
 * @return New tensor or NULL on error
 */
vsla_tensor_t* vsla_from_polynomial(const double* coeffs, size_t degree, 
                                    vsla_dtype_t dtype);

/**
 * @brief Backward pass for convolution (for autograd)
 * 
 * Computes gradients with respect to inputs given output gradient.
 * 
 * @param grad_a Gradient w.r.t. first input (pre-allocated)
 * @param grad_b Gradient w.r.t. second input (pre-allocated)
 * @param grad_out Gradient of output
 * @param a Forward pass first input
 * @param b Forward pass second input
 * @return VSLA_SUCCESS or error code
 */
vsla_error_t vsla_conv_backward(vsla_tensor_t* grad_a, vsla_tensor_t* grad_b,
                               const vsla_tensor_t* grad_out,
                               const vsla_tensor_t* a, const vsla_tensor_t* b);

#ifdef __cplusplus
}
#endif

#endif /* VSLA_CONV_H */

file.content:
cmake_minimum_required(VERSION 3.14)
project(libvsla VERSION 1.0.0 LANGUAGES C CXX)

# Options
option(BUILD_SHARED_LIBS "Build shared libraries" ON)
option(BUILD_TESTS "Build tests" ON)
option(BUILD_EXAMPLES "Build examples" ON)
option(VSLA_BUILD_PYTHON "Build Python bindings" OFF)
option(VSLA_ENABLE_TESTS "Enable testing" ON)
option(VSLA_ENABLE_BENCHMARKS "Enable benchmarks" OFF)
option(USE_FFTW "Use FFTW library for FFT operations" OFF)
option(VSLA_ENABLE_CUDA "Enable CUDA GPU acceleration" OFF)
option(VSLA_ENABLE_CUFFT "Enable cuFFT for GPU FFT operations" OFF)
option(VSLA_ENABLE_ROCFFT "Enable rocFFT for AMD GPU FFT operations" OFF)
option(VSLA_ENABLE_MKL "Enable Intel MKL for CPU FFT operations" OFF)
option(VSLA_UNIFIED_API "Build unified hardware-agnostic API" ON)

# C99 standard
set(CMAKE_C_STANDARD 99)
set(CMAKE_C_STANDARD_REQUIRED ON)
set(CMAKE_C_EXTENSIONS OFF)

# Compiler flags
if(CMAKE_C_COMPILER_ID MATCHES "GNU|Clang")
    add_compile_options(-Wall -Wextra -Wpedantic -Wstrict-prototypes)
    if(CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE STREQUAL "Debug")
        add_compile_options(-g -O0)
    else()
        add_compile_options(-O3)
    endif()
endif()

# Find packages
find_package(Threads REQUIRED)
if(USE_FFTW)
    find_package(PkgConfig)
    if(PkgConfig_FOUND)
        pkg_check_modules(FFTW fftw3)
    endif()
endif()

# Vendor FFT libraries
if(VSLA_ENABLE_CUFFT)
    find_package(CUDAToolkit REQUIRED)
    if(NOT CUDAToolkit_cufft_FOUND)
        message(FATAL_ERROR "cuFFT not found but VSLA_ENABLE_CUFFT is ON")
    endif()
endif()

if(VSLA_ENABLE_ROCFFT)
    find_package(rocfft QUIET)
    if(NOT rocfft_FOUND)
        message(WARNING "rocFFT not found, disabling rocFFT support")
        set(VSLA_ENABLE_ROCFFT OFF)
    endif()
endif()

if(VSLA_ENABLE_MKL)
    find_package(MKL QUIET)
    if(NOT MKL_FOUND)
        find_package(PkgConfig)
        if(PkgConfig_FOUND)
            pkg_check_modules(MKL mkl-dynamic-lp64)
        endif()
        if(NOT MKL_FOUND)
            message(WARNING "Intel MKL not found, disabling MKL support")
            set(VSLA_ENABLE_MKL OFF)
        endif()
    endif()
endif()

# CUDA support
if(VSLA_ENABLE_CUDA)
    # Set environment variables before enabling CUDA language
    set(ENV{CUDAHOSTCXX} "/usr/bin/g++")
    set(ENV{CUDACXX} "/usr/local/cuda-12.6/bin/nvcc")
    
    # Set flags before enabling the language
    set(CMAKE_CUDA_FLAGS "-allow-unsupported-compiler -std=c++17")
    set(CMAKE_CUDA_FLAGS "${CMAKE_CUDA_FLAGS} -D__STDC_WANT_IEC_60559_TYPES_EXT__=0")
    set(CMAKE_CUDA_FLAGS "${CMAKE_CUDA_FLAGS} -D__STDC_WANT_IEC_60559_FUNCS_EXT__=0")
    set(CMAKE_CUDA_FLAGS "${CMAKE_CUDA_FLAGS} -D__STDC_WANT_IEC_60559_ATTRIBS_EXT__=0")
    set(CMAKE_CUDA_FLAGS "${CMAKE_CUDA_FLAGS} -D__STDC_WANT_IEC_60559_BFP_EXT__=0")
    set(CMAKE_CUDA_FLAGS "${CMAKE_CUDA_FLAGS} -D__STDC_WANT_IEC_60559_DFP_EXT__=0")
    set(CMAKE_CUDA_FLAGS "${CMAKE_CUDA_FLAGS} -D__STDC_WANT_IEC_60559_EXT__=0")
    
    enable_language(CUDA)
    find_package(CUDAToolkit REQUIRED)
    set(CMAKE_CUDA_STANDARD 17)
    set(CMAKE_CUDA_STANDARD_REQUIRED ON)
    # Use older CUDA architecture that's more compatible
    set(CMAKE_CUDA_ARCHITECTURES "70;75;80;86;89;90")
endif()

# Include directories
include_directories(${CMAKE_CURRENT_SOURCE_DIR}/include)

# Source files
set(VSLA_SOURCES
    src/vsla_core.c

file.content:
set(VSLA_SOURCES
    src/vsla_core.c
    src/vsla_tensor.c
    src/vsla_ops.c
    src/vsla_io.c
    src/vsla_conv.c
    src/vsla_kron.c
    src/vsla_autograd.c
    src/vsla_utils.c
)

# Add unified API sources if enabled
if(VSLA_UNIFIED_API)
    list(APPEND VSLA_SOURCES 
        src/vsla_unified.c
    )
endif()

# Add vendor FFT sources
if(VSLA_ENABLE_CUFFT)
    list(APPEND VSLA_SOURCES src/vsla_fft_cufft.c)
endif()

if(VSLA_ENABLE_ROCFFT)
    list(APPEND VSLA_SOURCES src/vsla_fft_rocfft.c)
endif()

if(VSLA_ENABLE_MKL)
    list(APPEND VSLA_SOURCES src/vsla_fft_mkl.c)
endif()

# Add GPU sources conditionally
if(VSLA_ENABLE_CUDA)
    list(APPEND VSLA_SOURCES src/vsla_gpu.cu)
else()
    list(APPEND VSLA_SOURCES src/vsla_gpu.c)
endif()

# Create library targets
add_library(vsla_static STATIC ${VSLA_SOURCES})
set_target_properties(vsla_static PROPERTIES OUTPUT_NAME vsla)
target_link_libraries(vsla_static PRIVATE Threads::Threads m)

if(BUILD_SHARED_LIBS)
    add_library(vsla_shared SHARED ${VSLA_SOURCES})
    set_target_properties(vsla_shared PROPERTIES OUTPUT_NAME vsla)
    target_link_libraries(vsla_shared PRIVATE Threads::Threads m)
    if(USE_FFTW AND FFTW_FOUND)
        target_link_libraries(vsla_shared PRIVATE ${FFTW_LIBRARIES})
        target_include_directories(vsla_shared PRIVATE ${FFTW_INCLUDE_DIRS})

content.text: I'll analyze the VSLA unified API architecture and implementation comprehensively. Let me start by reading the key files to understand the current state.

content.content:
1â†’/**
     2â†’ * @file vsla_unified.h
     3â†’ * @brief Hardware-agnostic unified interface for VSLA operations
     4â†’ * 
     5â†’ * This module provides a single, simple API that automatically uses the best
     6â†’ * available hardware (CPU/GPU) and vendor libraries (cuFFT, rocFFT, MKL) to
     7â†’ * achieve maximum performance without requiring users to manage hardware details.
     8â†’ * 
     9â†’ * @copyright MIT License
    10â†’ */
    11â†’
    12â†’#ifndef VSLA_UNIFIED_H
    13â†’#define VSLA_UNIFIED_H
    14â†’
    15â†’#include "vsla_core.h"
    16â†’#include "vsla_tensor.h"
    17â†’#include <stdbool.h>
    18â†’#include <stddef.h>
    19â†’
    20â†’#ifdef __cplusplus
    21â†’extern "C" {
    22â†’#endif
    23â†’
    24â†’/**
    25â†’ * @brief Hardware backend type
    26â†’ */
    27â†’typedef enum {
    28â†’    VSLA_BACKEND_CPU = 0,           /**< CPU-only execution */
    29â†’    VSLA_BACKEND_CUDA = 1,          /**< NVIDIA GPU via CUDA */
    30â†’    VSLA_BACKEND_ROCM = 2,          /**< AMD GPU via ROCm */
    31â†’    VSLA_BACKEND_ONEAPI = 3,        /**< Intel GPU via oneAPI */
    32â†’    VSLA_BACKEND_AUTO = 4           /**< Auto-select best available */
    33â†’} vsla_backend_t;
    34â†’
    35â†’/**
    36â†’ * @brief Unified tensor structure that abstracts CPU/GPU memory
    37â†’ */
    38â†’typedef struct vsla_unified_tensor vsla_unified_tensor_t;
    39â†’
    40â†’/**
    41â†’ * @brief VSLA runtime context for managing hardware resources
    42â†’ */
    43â†’typedef struct vsla_unified_context vsla_context_t;
    44â†’
    45â†’/**
    46â†’ * @brief Performance hints for optimization
    47â†’ */
    48â†’typedef enum {
    49â†’    VSLA_HINT_NONE = 0,             /**< No specific hints */
    50â†’    VSLA_HINT_LATENCY = 1,          /**< Optimize for low latency */
    51â†’    VSLA_HINT_THROUGHPUT = 2,       /**< Optimize for high throughput */
    52â†’    VSLA_HINT_MEMORY = 3,           /**< Optimize for memory efficiency */
    53â†’    VSLA_HINT_ENERGY = 4            /**< Optimize for energy efficiency */
    54â†’} vsla_hint_t;
    55â†’
    56â†’/**
    57â†’ * @brief Runtime configuration
    58â†’ */
    59â†’typedef struct {
    60â†’    vsla_backend_t backend;         /**< Preferred backend (AUTO recommended) */
    61â†’    int device_id;                  /**< Device ID (-1 for auto-select) */
    62â†’    size_t memory_limit;            /**< Memory limit in bytes (0 = no limit) */
    63â†’    vsla_hint_t optimization_hint;  /**< Performance optimization hint */
    64â†’    bool enable_profiling;          /**< Enable performance profiling */

   468â†’// === Stacking Operations ===
   469â†’
   470â†’/**
   471â†’ * @brief Stack tensors along new leading axis (Î£ operator)
   472â†’ * 
   473â†’ * Implements the mathematical stacking operator Î£_k: (ğ•‹_r)^k â†’ ğ•‹_{r+1}
   474â†’ * that creates a rank-(r+1) tensor by stacking k rank-r tensors along a 
   475â†’ * new leading axis.
   476â†’ * 
   477â†’ * Mathematical properties:
   478â†’ * - Associativity (nested levels)
   479â†’ * - Neutral-zero absorption
   480â†’ * - Distributivity over +, âŠ™
   481â†’ * - Forms strict monoidal category (ğ•‹_r, +, Î£)
   482â†’ * 
   483â†’ * @param ctx VSLA context
   484â†’ * @param out Output tensor of rank r+1
   485â†’ * @param tensors Array of k input tensors (all rank r)
   486â†’ * @param count Number of tensors to stack
   487â†’ * @return VSLA_SUCCESS on success
   488â†’ */
   489â†’vsla_error_t vsla_stack(vsla_context_t* ctx,
   490â†’                        vsla_tensor_t* out,
   491â†’                        const vsla_tensor_t** tensors,
   492â†’                        size_t count);
   493â†’
   494â†’/**
   495â†’ * @brief Create stacked tensor (convenience function)
   496â†’ * 
   497â†’ * Automatically determines output shape and allocates result tensor.
   498â†’ * 
   499â†’ * @param ctx VSLA context
   500â†’ * @param tensors Array of input tensors
   501â†’ * @param count Number of tensors to stack
   502â†’ * @return New stacked tensor or NULL on error
   503â†’ */
   504â†’vsla_tensor_t* vsla_stack_create(vsla_context_t* ctx,
   505â†’                                 const vsla_tensor_t** tensors,
   506â†’                                 size_t count);
   507â†’
   508â†’/**
   509â†’ * @brief Unstack tensor along leading axis
   510â†’ * 
   511â†’ * Inverse of stacking. Splits rank-(r+1) tensor into k rank-r tensors.
   512â†’ * 
   513â†’ * @param ctx VSLA context
   514â†’ * @param tensor Input tensor to unstack
   515â†’ * @param outputs Array to receive unstacked tensors
   516â†’ * @param max_outputs Size of outputs array
   517â†’ * @param num_outputs Actual number of tensors produced
   518â†’ * @return VSLA_SUCCESS on success
   519â†’ */
   520â†’vsla_error_t vsla_unstack(vsla_context_t* ctx,
   521â†’                          const vsla_tensor_t* tensor,
   522â†’                          vsla_tensor_t** outputs,
   523â†’                          size_t max_outputs,
   524â†’                          size_t* num_outputs);

   598â†’// === Batch Operations ===
   599â†’
   600â†’/**
   601â†’ * @brief Execute multiple operations as a batch for efficiency
   602â†’ * 
   603â†’ * @param ctx VSLA context
   604â†’ * @param ops Array of operation descriptors
   605â†’ * @param count Number of operations
   606â†’ * @return VSLA_SUCCESS if all operations succeed
   607â†’ */
   608â†’typedef struct {
   609â†’    enum {
   610â†’        VSLA_OP_ADD,
   611â†’        VSLA_OP_SUB,
   612â†’        VSLA_OP_SCALE,
   613â†’        VSLA_OP_HADAMARD,
   614â†’        VSLA_OP_CONV,
   615â†’        VSLA_OP_MATMUL,
   616â†’        VSLA_OP_TRANSPOSE,
   617â†’        VSLA_OP_RELU,
   618â†’        VSLA_OP_SIGMOID,
   619â†’        VSLA_OP_TANH
   620â†’    } type;
   621â†’    vsla_tensor_t* out;
   622â†’    const vsla_tensor_t* in1;
   623â†’    const vsla_tensor_t* in2;
   624â†’    double scalar;
   625â†’} vsla_operation_t;
   626â†’
   627â†’vsla_error_t vsla_batch_execute(vsla_context_t* ctx,
   628â†’                                const vsla_operation_t* ops,
   629â†’                                size_t count);
   630â†’
   631â†’// === Performance and Profiling ===
   632â†’
   633â†’/**
   634â†’ * @brief Get performance statistics
   635â†’ */
   636â†’typedef struct {
   637â†’    uint64_t total_operations;      /**< Total operations executed */
   638â†’    uint64_t gpu_operations;        /**< Operations executed on GPU */
   639â†’    uint64_t cpu_operations;        /**< Operations executed on CPU */
   640â†’    double total_time_ms;           /**< Total execution time */
   641â†’    double gpu_time_ms;             /**< GPU execution time */
   642â†’    double cpu_time_ms;             /**< CPU execution time */
   643â†’    double transfer_time_ms;        /**< CPU<->GPU transfer time */
   644â†’    size_t memory_used_mb;          /**< Current memory usage */
   645â†’    size_t peak_memory_mb;          /**< Peak memory usage */
   646â†’} vsla_stats_t;
   647â†’
   648â†’vsla_error_t vsla_get_stats(const vsla_context_t* ctx, vsla_stats_t* stats);
   649â†’
   650â†’/**
   651â†’ * @brief Reset performance statistics
   652â†’ */
   653â†’vsla_error_t vsla_reset_stats(vsla_context_t* ctx);
   654â†’
   655â†’/**
   656â†’ * @brief Synchronize all pending operations
   657â†’ * 
   658â†’ * Ensures all asynchronous operations are complete.
   659â†’ */
   660â†’vsla_error_t vsla_synchronize(vsla_context_t* ctx);
   661â†’
   662â†’// === Utility Functions ===
   663â†’
   664â†’/**
   665â†’ * @brief Set optimization hint for subsequent operations
   666â†’ */
   667â†’vsla_error_t vsla_set_hint(vsla_context_t* ctx, vsla_hint_t hint);
   668â†’
   669â†’/**
   670â†’ * @brief Enable/disable automatic tensor migration between CPU/GPU
   671â†’ */
   672â†’vsla_error_t vsla_set_auto_migration(vsla_context_t* ctx, bool enable);
   673â†’
   674â†’/**
   675â†’ * @brief Prefetch tensor to optimal device for upcoming operations
   676â†’ */
   677â†’vsla_error_t vsla_tensor_prefetch(vsla_context_t* ctx, vsla_tensor_t* tensor);
   678â†’
   679â†’/**
   680â†’ * @brief Get recommended backend for given operation
   681â†’ */
   682â†’vsla_backend_t vsla_recommend_backend(vsla_context_t* ctx,
   683â†’                                       const char* operation,
   684â†’                                       const vsla_tensor_t** inputs,
   685â†’                                       size_t input_count);
   686â†’
   687â†’#ifdef __cplusplus
   688â†’}
   689â†’#endif
   690â†’
   691â†’#endif // VSLA_UNIFIED_H

/**
 * @file vsla_ops.h
 * @brief Basic operations on VSLA tensors
 * 
 * @copyright MIT License
 */

#ifndef VSLA_OPS_H
#define VSLA_OPS_H

#include "vsla_tensor.h"

#ifdef __cplusplus
extern "C" {
#endif

/**
 * @brief Expand the rank of a tensor by adding new dimensions
 * 
 * This is a zero-copy operation that increases the rank of a tensor by
 * appending new dimensions. The original data is preserved, and the new
 * dimensions are implicitly zero-padded.
 * 
 * @param tensor Input tensor
 * @param new_rank New rank (must be >= current rank)
 * @param target_cap Array of target capacities for new dimensions (can be NULL)
 * @return VSLA_SUCCESS or error code
 */
vsla_error_t vsla_pad_rank(vsla_tensor_t* tensor, uint8_t new_rank, 
                           const uint64_t target_cap[]);

/**
 * @brief Add two tensors element-wise
 * 
 * Performs element-wise addition after automatic padding to compatible shapes.
 * The output tensor must be pre-allocated with sufficient capacity.
 * 
 * @param out Output tensor (pre-allocated)
 * @param a First input tensor
 * @param b Second input tensor
 * @return VSLA_SUCCESS or error code
 */
vsla_error_t vsla_add_basic(vsla_tensor_t* out, const vsla_tensor_t* a, 
                            const vsla_tensor_t* b);

/**
 * @brief Subtract two tensors element-wise
 * 
 * @param out Output tensor (pre-allocated)
 * @param a First input tensor
 * @param b Second input tensor
 * @return VSLA_SUCCESS or error code
 */
vsla_error_t vsla_sub_basic(vsla_tensor_t* out, const vsla_tensor_t* a, 
                            const vsla_tensor_t* b);

/**
 * @brief Scale a tensor by a scalar
 * 
 * @param out Output tensor (can be same as input for in-place operation)
 * @param tensor Input tensor
 * @param scalar Scalar multiplier
 * @return VSLA_SUCCESS or error code
 */
vsla_error_t vsla_scale_basic(vsla_tensor_t* out, const vsla_tensor_t* tensor, 
                              double scalar);

/**
 * @brief Element-wise multiplication (Hadamard product)
 * 
 * @param out Output tensor (pre-allocated)
 * @param a First input tensor
 * @param b Second input tensor
 * @return VSLA_SUCCESS or error code
 */
vsla_error_t vsla_hadamard_basic(vsla_tensor_t* out, const vsla_tensor_t* a, 
                                 const vsla_tensor_t* b);

/**
 * @brief Matrix multiplication for 2D tensors
 * 
 * @param out Output tensor (pre-allocated)
 * @param a First matrix
 * @param b Second matrix
 * @return VSLA_SUCCESS or error code
 */
vsla_error_t vsla_matmul_basic(vsla_tensor_t* out, const vsla_tensor_t* a, 
                               const vsla_tensor_t* b);

/**
 * @brief Transpose a 2D tensor (matrix)
 * 
 * @param out Output tensor (pre-allocated)
 * @param tensor Input tensor (must be rank 2)
 * @return VSLA_SUCCESS or error code
 */
vsla_error_t vsla_transpose_basic(vsla_tensor_t* out, const vsla_tensor_t* tensor);

/**
 * @brief Reshape a tensor (must preserve total number of elements)
 * 
 * @param tensor Tensor to reshape
 * @param new_rank New rank
 * @param new_shape New shape array
 * @return VSLA_SUCCESS or error code
 */
vsla_error_t vsla_reshape_basic(vsla_tensor_t* tensor, uint8_t new_rank, 
                                const uint64_t new_shape[]);

/**
 * @brief Create a view (slice) of a tensor
 * 
 * @param tensor Source tensor
 * @param start Start indices for each dimension
 * @param end End indices for each dimension (exclusive)
 * @return New tensor view, or NULL on error
 */
vsla_tensor_t* vsla_slice(const vsla_tensor_t* tensor, const uint64_t start[], 
                          const uint64_t end[]);

/**
 * @brief Compute the Frobenius norm of a tensor
 * 
 * @param tensor Input tensor
 * @param norm Output norm value
 * @return VSLA_SUCCESS or error code
 */
vsla_error_t vsla_norm_basic(const vsla_tensor_t* tensor, double* norm);

/**
 * @brief Compute the sum of all elements
 * 
 * @param tensor Input tensor
 * @param sum Output sum value
 * @return VSLA_SUCCESS or error code
 */
vsla_error_t vsla_sum_basic(const vsla_tensor_t* tensor, double* sum);

/**
 * @brief Find the maximum element
 * 
 * @param tensor Input tensor
 * @param max Output maximum value
 * @return VSLA_SUCCESS or error code
 */
vsla_error_t vsla_max_basic(const vsla_tensor_t* tensor, double* max);

/**
 * @brief Find the minimum element
 * 
 * @param tensor Input tensor
 * @param min Output minimum value
 * @return VSLA_SUCCESS or error code
 */
vsla_error_t vsla_min_basic(const vsla_tensor_t* tensor, double* min);

#ifdef __cplusplus
}
#endif

#endif /* VSLA_OPS_H */

content.content:
1â†’/**
     2â†’ * @file vsla_tensor.h
     3â†’ * @brief Core tensor data structure and basic operations
     4â†’ * 
     5â†’ * @copyright MIT License
     6â†’ */
     7â†’
     8â†’#ifndef VSLA_TENSOR_H
     9â†’#define VSLA_TENSOR_H
    10â†’
    11â†’#include "vsla_core.h"
    12â†’
    13â†’#ifdef __cplusplus
    14â†’extern "C" {
    15â†’#endif
    16â†’
    17â†’/**
    18â†’ * @brief Core tensor structure for VSLA
    19â†’ * 
    20â†’ * This structure represents a multi-dimensional tensor with variable shape.
    21â†’ * The tensor supports automatic zero-padding to make operations between
    22â†’ * tensors of different shapes well-defined.
    23â†’ */
    24â†’typedef struct {
    25â†’    uint8_t    rank;      /**< Number of axes (dimensions), 0-255 */
    26â†’    uint8_t    model;     /**< Model: 0 = convolution, 1 = Kronecker */
    27â†’    uint8_t    dtype;     /**< Data type: 0 = f64, 1 = f32 */
    28â†’    uint8_t    flags;     /**< Reserved for future use */
    29â†’
    30â†’    uint64_t  *shape;     /**< Logical extent per axis (length = rank) */
    31â†’    uint64_t  *cap;       /**< Padded/allocated extent per axis */
    32â†’    uint64_t  *stride;    /**< Byte strides for row-major traversal */
    33â†’    void      *data;      /**< Contiguous buffer, size = Î  cap[i] * sizeof(dtype) */
    34â†’} vsla_tensor_t;
    35â†’
    36â†’/**
    37â†’ * @brief Create a new tensor
    38â†’ * 
    39â†’ * Allocates a new tensor with the specified rank, shape, model, and data type.
    40â†’ * The capacity (cap) for each dimension is set to the next power of 2 >= shape[i].
    41â†’ * 
    42â†’ * @param rank Number of dimensions (0-255)
    43â†’ * @param shape Array of dimension sizes (length = rank)
    44â†’ * @param model Model type (VSLA_MODEL_A or VSLA_MODEL_B)
    45â†’ * @param dtype Data type (VSLA_DTYPE_F64 or VSLA_DTYPE_F32)
    46â†’ * @return Pointer to new tensor, or NULL on error
    47â†’ */
    48â†’vsla_tensor_t* vsla_new(uint8_t rank, const uint64_t shape[], 
    49â†’                        vsla_model_t model, vsla_dtype_t dtype);
    50â†’
    51â†’/**
    52â†’ * @brief Free a tensor and all its allocated memory
    53â†’ * 
    54â†’ * @param tensor Tensor to free (can be NULL)
    55â†’ */
    56â†’void vsla_free(vsla_tensor_t* tensor);
    57â†’
    58â†’/**
    59â†’ * @brief Create a copy of a tensor
    60â†’ * 
    61â†’ * @param tensor Tensor to copy
    62â†’ * @return New tensor with copied data, or NULL on error
    63â†’ */
    64â†’vsla_tensor_t* vsla_copy_basic(const vsla_tensor_t* tensor);
    65â†’
    66â†’/**
    67â†’ * @brief Create a tensor filled with zeros
    68â†’ * 
    69â†’ * @param rank Number of dimensions
    70â†’ * @param shape Array of dimension sizes
    71â†’ * @param model Model type
    72â†’ * @param dtype Data type
    73â†’ * @return New zero tensor, or NULL on error
    74â†’ */
    75â†’vsla_tensor_t* vsla_zeros(uint8_t rank, const uint64_t shape[],
    76â†’                          vsla_model_t model, vsla_dtype_t dtype);
    77â†’
    78â†’/**
    79â†’ * @brief Create a tensor filled with ones
    80â†’ * 
    81â†’ * @param rank Number of dimensions
    82â†’ * @param shape Array of dimension sizes
    83â†’ * @param model Model type
    84â†’ * @param dtype Data type
    85â†’ * @return New tensor filled with ones, or NULL on error
    86â†’ */
    87â†’vsla_tensor_t* vsla_ones(uint8_t rank, const uint64_t shape[],
    88â†’                         vsla_model_t model, vsla_dtype_t dtype);
    89â†’
    90â†’/**
    91â†’ * @brief Get the total number of elements in the tensor (based on shape)
    92â†’ * 
    93â†’ * @param tensor Input tensor
    94â†’ * @return Number of elements, or 0 if tensor is NULL
    95â†’ */
    96â†’uint64_t vsla_numel(const vsla_tensor_t* tensor);
    97â†’
    98â†’/**
    99â†’ * @brief Get the total allocated capacity (based on cap)
   100â†’ * 
   101â†’ * @param tensor Input tensor
   102â†’ * @return Total capacity, or 0 if tensor is NULL
   103â†’ */
   104â†’uint64_t vsla_capacity(const vsla_tensor_t* tensor);
   105â†’
   106â†’/**
   107â†’ * @brief Get a pointer to an element in the tensor
   108â†’ * 
   109â†’ * @param tensor Input tensor
   110â†’ * @param indices Array of indices (length = rank)
   111â†’ * @return Pointer to element, or NULL if out of bounds
   112â†’ */
   113â†’void* vsla_get_ptr(const vsla_tensor_t* tensor, const uint64_t indices[]);
   114â†’
   115â†’/**
   116â†’ * @brief Get a double value from the tensor (with type conversion if needed)
   117â†’ * 
   118â†’ * @param tensor Input tensor
   119â†’ * @param indices Array of indices
   120â†’ * @param value Output value
   121â†’ * @return VSLA_SUCCESS or error code
   122â†’ */
   123â†’vsla_error_t vsla_get_f64(const vsla_tensor_t* tensor, const uint64_t indices[], 
   124â†’                          double* value);
   125â†’
   126â†’/**
   127â†’ * @brief Set a double value in the tensor (with type conversion if needed)
   128â†’ * 
   129â†’ * @param tensor Input tensor
   130â†’ * @param indices Array of indices
   131â†’ * @param value Value to set
   132â†’ * @return VSLA_SUCCESS or error code
   133â†’ */
   134â†’vsla_error_t vsla_set_f64(vsla_tensor_t* tensor, const uint64_t indices[], 
   135â†’                          double value);
   136â†’
   137â†’/**
   138â†’ * @brief Fill tensor with a constant value
   139â†’ * 
   140â†’ * @param tensor Tensor to fill
   141â†’ * @param value Value to fill with
   142â†’ * @return VSLA_SUCCESS or error code
   143â†’ */
   144â†’vsla_error_t vsla_fill_basic(vsla_tensor_t* tensor, double value);
   145â†’
   146â†’/**
   147â†’ * @brief Print tensor information to stdout
   148â†’ * 
   149â†’ * @param tensor Tensor to print
   150â†’ * @param name Optional name for the tensor
   151â†’ */
   152â†’void vsla_print(const vsla_tensor_t* tensor, const char* name);
   153â†’
   154â†’/**
   155â†’ * @brief Check if two tensors have the same shape
   156â†’ * 
   157â†’ * @param a First tensor
   158â†’ * @param b Second tensor
   159â†’ * @return 1 if shapes match, 0 otherwise
   160â†’ */
   161â†’int vsla_shape_equal(const vsla_tensor_t* a, const vsla_tensor_t* b);
   162â†’
   163â†’/**
   164â†’ * @brief Create the zero element for the semiring
   165â†’ * 
   166â†’ * @param model Model type
   167â†’ * @param dtype Data type
   168â†’ * @return Zero tensor (empty tensor), or NULL on error
   169â†’ */
   170â†’vsla_tensor_t* vsla_zero_element(vsla_model_t model, vsla_dtype_t dtype);
   171â†’
   172â†’/**
   173â†’ * @brief Create the one element for the semiring
   174â†’ * 
   175â†’ * @param model Model type
   176â†’ * @param dtype Data type
   177â†’ * @return One tensor (1D tensor with single element 1), or NULL on error
   178â†’ */
   179â†’vsla_tensor_t* vsla_one_element(vsla_model_t model, vsla_dtype_t dtype);
   180â†’
   181â†’#ifdef __cplusplus
   182â†’}
   183â†’#endif
   184â†’
   185â†’#endif /* VSLA_TENSOR_H */

/**
 * @file vsla_tensor.h
 * @brief Core tensor data structure and basic operations
 * 
 * @copyright MIT License
 */

#ifndef VSLA_TENSOR_H
#define VSLA_TENSOR_H

#include "vsla_core.h"

#ifdef __cplusplus
extern "C" {
#endif

/**
 * @brief Core tensor structure for VSLA
 * 
 * This structure represents a multi-dimensional tensor with variable shape.
 * The tensor supports automatic zero-padding to make operations between
 * tensors of different shapes well-defined.
 */
typedef struct {
    uint8_t    rank;      /**< Number of axes (dimensions), 0-255 */
    uint8_t    model;     /**< Model: 0 = convolution, 1 = Kronecker */
    uint8_t    dtype;     /**< Data type: 0 = f64, 1 = f32 */
    uint8_t    flags;     /**< Reserved for future use */

    uint64_t  *shape;     /**< Logical extent per axis (length = rank) */
    uint64_t  *cap;       /**< Padded/allocated extent per axis */
    uint64_t  *stride;    /**< Byte strides for row-major traversal */
    void      *data;      /**< Contiguous buffer, size = Î  cap[i] * sizeof(dtype) */
} vsla_tensor_t;

/**
 * @brief Create a new tensor
 * 
 * Allocates a new tensor with the specified rank, shape, model, and data type.
 * The capacity (cap) for each dimension is set to the next power of 2 >= shape[i].
 * 
 * @param rank Number of dimensions (0-255)
 * @param shape Array of dimension sizes (length = rank)
 * @param model Model type (VSLA_MODEL_A or VSLA_MODEL_B)
 * @param dtype Data type (VSLA_DTYPE_F64 or VSLA_DTYPE_F32)
 * @return Pointer to new tensor, or NULL on error
 */
vsla_tensor_t* vsla_new(uint8_t rank, const uint64_t shape[], 
                        vsla_model_t model, vsla_dtype_t dtype);

/**
 * @brief Free a tensor and all its allocated memory
 * 
 * @param tensor Tensor to free (can be NULL)
 */
void vsla_free(vsla_tensor_t* tensor);

/**
 * @brief Create a copy of a tensor
 * 
 * @param tensor Tensor to copy
 * @return New tensor with copied data, or NULL on error
 */
vsla_tensor_t* vsla_copy_basic(const vsla_tensor_t* tensor);

/**
 * @brief Create a tensor filled with zeros
 * 
 * @param rank Number of dimensions
 * @param shape Array of dimension sizes
 * @param model Model type
 * @param dtype Data type
 * @return New zero tensor, or NULL on error
 */
vsla_tensor_t* vsla_zeros(uint8_t rank, const uint64_t shape[],
                          vsla_model_t model, vsla_dtype_t dtype);

/**
 * @brief Create a tensor filled with ones
 * 
 * @param rank Number of dimensions
 * @param shape Array of dimension sizes
 * @param model Model type
 * @param dtype Data type
 * @return New tensor filled with ones, or NULL on error
 */
vsla_tensor_t* vsla_ones(uint8_t rank, const uint64_t shape[],
                         vsla_model_t model, vsla_dtype_t dtype);

/**
 * @brief Get the total number of elements in the tensor (based on shape)
 * 
 * @param tensor Input tensor
 * @return Number of elements, or 0 if tensor is NULL
 */
uint64_t vsla_numel(const vsla_tensor_t* tensor);

/**
 * @brief Get the total allocated capacity (based on cap)
 * 
 * @param tensor Input tensor
 * @return Total capacity, or 0 if tensor is NULL
 */
uint64_t vsla_capacity(const vsla_tensor_t* tensor);

/**
 * @brief Get a pointer to an element in the tensor
 * 
 * @param tensor Input tensor
 * @param indices Array of indices (length = rank)
 * @return Pointer to element, or NULL if out of bounds
 */
void* vsla_get_ptr(const vsla_tensor_t* tensor, const uint64_t indices[]);

/**
 * @brief Get a double value from the tensor (with type conversion if needed)
 * 
 * @param tensor Input tensor
 * @param indices Array of indices
 * @param value Output value
 * @return VSLA_SUCCESS or error code
 */
vsla_error_t vsla_get_f64(const vsla_tensor_t* tensor, const uint64_t indices[], 
                          double* value);

/**
 * @brief Set a double value in the tensor (with type conversion if needed)
 * 
 * @param tensor Input tensor
 * @param indices Array of indices
 * @param value Value to set
 * @return VSLA_SUCCESS or error code
 */
vsla_error_t vsla_set_f64(vsla_tensor_t* tensor, const uint64_t indices[], 
                          double value);

/**
 * @brief Fill tensor with a constant value
 * 
 * @param tensor Tensor to fill
 * @param value Value to fill with
 * @return VSLA_SUCCESS or error code
 */
vsla_error_t vsla_fill_basic(vsla_tensor_t* tensor, double value);

/**
 * @brief Print tensor information to stdout
 * 
 * @param tensor Tensor to print
 * @param name Optional name for the tensor
 */
void vsla_print(const vsla_tensor_t* tensor, const char* name);

/**
 * @brief Check if two tensors have the same shape
 * 
 * @param a First tensor
 * @param b Second tensor
 * @return 1 if shapes match, 0 otherwise
 */
int vsla_shape_equal(const vsla_tensor_t* a, const vsla_tensor_t* b);

/**
 * @brief Create the zero element for the semiring
 * 
 * @param model Model type
 * @param dtype Data type
 * @return Zero tensor (empty tensor), or NULL on error
 */
vsla_tensor_t* vsla_zero_element(vsla_model_t model, vsla_dtype_t dtype);

/**
 * @brief Create the one element for the semiring
 * 
 * @param model Model type
 * @param dtype Data type
 * @return One tensor (1D tensor with single element 1), or NULL on error
 */
vsla_tensor_t* vsla_one_element(vsla_model_t model, vsla_dtype_t dtype);

#ifdef __cplusplus
}
#endif

#endif /* VSLA_TENSOR_H */

    43â†’ * @return VSLA_SUCCESS or error code

file.content:
/**
 * @file vsla_conv.h
 * @brief Model A operations - Convolution semiring
 * 
 * @copyright MIT License
 */

#ifndef VSLA_CONV_H
#define VSLA_CONV_H

#include "vsla_tensor.h"

#ifdef __cplusplus
extern "C" {
#endif

/**
 * @brief Convolution of two tensors (Model A multiplication)
 * 
 * Computes the discrete convolution of two tensors. For vectors v and w:
 * (v * w)_k = sum_{i+j=k+1} v_i * w_j
 * 
 * The output dimension is d1 + d2 - 1 where d1 and d2 are the input dimensions.
 * Uses FFT for efficiency when available.
 * 
 * @param out Output tensor (pre-allocated with correct dimensions)
 * @param a First input tensor (must be Model A)
 * @param b Second input tensor (must be Model A)
 * @return VSLA_SUCCESS or error code
 */
vsla_error_t vsla_conv_basic(vsla_tensor_t* out, const vsla_tensor_t* a, 
                             const vsla_tensor_t* b);

/**
 * @brief Direct convolution (no FFT)
 * 
 * Computes convolution using the direct O(n*m) algorithm.
 * Useful for small tensors or when FFT is not available.
 * 
 * @param out Output tensor
 * @param a First input tensor
 * @param b Second input tensor
 * @return VSLA_SUCCESS or error code
 */
vsla_error_t vsla_conv_direct(vsla_tensor_t* out, const vsla_tensor_t* a, 
                              const vsla_tensor_t* b);

/**
 * @brief FFT-based convolution
 * 
 * Uses Fast Fourier Transform for O(n log n) convolution.
 * Falls back to radix-2 implementation if FFTW is not available.
 * 
 * @param out Output tensor
 * @param a First input tensor
 * @param b Second input tensor
 * @return VSLA_SUCCESS or error code
 */
vsla_error_t vsla_conv_fft(vsla_tensor_t* out, const vsla_tensor_t* a, 
                           const vsla_tensor_t* b);

/**
 * @brief Matrix multiplication for Model A
 * 
 * Performs matrix multiplication where each element is a Model A tensor
 * and multiplication uses convolution.
 * 
 * @param out Output matrix of tensors
 * @param A First matrix (m x k)
 * @param B Second matrix (k x n)
 * @param m Number of rows in A
 * @param k Number of columns in A / rows in B
 * @param n Number of columns in B
 * @return VSLA_SUCCESS or error code
 */
vsla_error_t vsla_matmul_conv(vsla_tensor_t** out, vsla_tensor_t** A, 
                              vsla_tensor_t** B, size_t m, size_t k, size_t n);

/**
 * @brief Compute polynomial coefficients from Model A tensor
 * 
 * Extracts the polynomial representation where tensor elements
 * are coefficients of x^0, x^1, x^2, ...
 * 
 * @param tensor Input tensor (Model A)
 * @param coeffs Output coefficient array (pre-allocated)
 * @param max_degree Maximum degree to extract
 * @return VSLA_SUCCESS or error code
 */
vsla_error_t vsla_to_polynomial(const vsla_tensor_t* tensor, double* coeffs, 
                                size_t max_degree);

/**
 * @brief Create Model A tensor from polynomial coefficients
 * 
 * @param coeffs Coefficient array
 * @param degree Polynomial degree
 * @param dtype Data type for tensor
 * @return New tensor or NULL on error
 */
vsla_tensor_t* vsla_from_polynomial(const double* coeffs, size_t degree, 
                                    vsla_dtype_t dtype);

/**
 * @brief Backward pass for convolution (for autograd)
 * 
 * Computes gradients with respect to inputs given output gradient.
 * 
 * @param grad_a Gradient w.r.t. first input (pre-allocated)
 * @param grad_b Gradient w.r.t. second input (pre-allocated)
 * @param grad_out Gradient of output
 * @param a Forward pass first input
 * @param b Forward pass second input
 * @return VSLA_SUCCESS or error code
 */
vsla_error_t vsla_conv_backward(vsla_tensor_t* grad_a, vsla_tensor_t* grad_b,
                               const vsla_tensor_t* grad_out,
                               const vsla_tensor_t* a, const vsla_tensor_t* b);

#ifdef __cplusplus
}
#endif

#endif /* VSLA_CONV_H */
